Class ConfigurablePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.ConfigurablePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class ConfigurablePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Building block of EMU, this abstract class extends a JPanel. It holds a map of UIProperty, UIParameter and InternalProperty. ConfigurablePanel subclasses should be instantiated within a ConfigurableMainFrame. The latter will collect their UIProperties, UIParameters and InternalProperties, and pass them on to the SystemController.

    Subclasses of ConfigurablePanel must implements few methods called in the ConfigurablePanel constructor in order to instantiate the UIProperties (initializeProperties()), UIParameters (initializeParameters()) and InternalProperties (initializeInternalProperties()), as well as setting up the JComponents in the JPanel (itself). All JComponent instantiations should happen in setupPanel(). Note that this method is the last one to be called in the ConfigurablePanel constructor, therefore the JPanel set up can also take place in the subclass constructor equivalently.

    UIProperties are aimed at linking the state of a MMProperty with the state of one or multiple JComponenents. InternalProperties are made to allow shared values between ConfigurablePanels, such that a modification to one panel can trigger a change in the other panel. Finally, UIProperties should only be used for user settings, such as changing the colors of JLabels or JButtons (to describe a filter or a laser) or the text of a header. All UIProperties and UIParameters appear in the ConfigurationWizard. The user can then map the UIProperties with a MMProperty and change the value of a UIParameter.

    In order to be added to the internal HashMap representation, UIproperties, UIParameters and InternalProperties need to be added using the following methods respectively: addUIProperty(UIProperty), addUIParameter(UIParameter) and addInternalProperty(InternalProperty).

    Modifications to the state of UIProperties and InternalProperties should not be done explicitly in the subclasses, but should be done through the abstraction methods: setUIPropertyValue(String, String) and setInternalPropertyValue(String, ?). UIParameters should not be modified within the subclasses. Modifications of the JComponents based on UIProperties, UIParameters and InternalProperties changes take place in the subclasses implementation of propertyhasChanged(String, String), parameterhasChanged(String) and internalpropertyhasChanged(String) respectively. To query the value of a UIParameter or an InternalProperty, use respectively the methods get{type of the UIParameter}UIParamterValue() and get{type of the InternalProperty}InternalPropertyValue().

    For instance, a JToggleButton can be designed to turn on and off a laser. After declaration of the JToggleButton and addition to the panel in setupPanel(), an eventListener can be added to the JToggleButton. The eventListener should then call setUIPropertyValue(String, String) to modify the corresponding UIProperty with a new value being on when the JToggleButton is selected, and an off value when the JToggleButton is unselected. More details can be found in tutorials and the javadocs of the different UIProperties implementations.

    Upon start up of the UIPlugin, the SystemController will pair up the UIProperties with MMProperty and the latter's values will be propagated to the ConfigurablePanel via propertyhasChanged(String, String). Later on, changes to a MMProperty (for instance by another ConfigurablePanel) will trigger the same method. The same mechanism is at play for the InternalProperties and the UIParameters. Note that the UIParameters are only changed upon start up and when the user modifies the configuration through the ConfigurationWizard.

    In addition, to avoid triggering setUIPropertyValue(String, String) through the eventListener when modifying the state of a JComponent (as it might happen depending on the eventListener type), turnOffComponentTriggering() can be called in the beginning of the subclasses implementation of propertyhasChanged(String, String) and turnOnComponentTriggering() at the end. These methods change the state of an internal member boolean variable. In the eventListener, the method isComponentTriggeringEnabled() can query the state of the boolean variable and decide to not call setUIPropertyValue(String, String). This mechanism is optional.

    Author:
    Joran Deschamps
    See Also:
    UIProperty, UIParameter, InternalProperty, ConfigurableMainFrame, Serialized Form

      • setUIPropertyValue

        protected void setUIPropertyValue(java.lang.String propertyName,
                      java.lang.String newValue)
        Sets the UIProperty propertyName's value to newValue. This method calls the UIProperty's method to set the value, which will in turn call the corresponding MMProperty's method. Since the change will be notified to all the UIProperties listening to the MMProperty (through triggerPropertyHasChanged(String, String)), this method runs on an independent thread (that is, not on the EDT).
        Parameters:
        propertyName - UIProperty's name
        newValue - New value

      • setInternalPropertyValue

        protected void setInternalPropertyValue(java.lang.String propertyName,
                            int newValue)
        Sets the value of the IntegerInternalProperty called propertyName to newValue. If propertyName doesn't exist or is not an IntegerInternalProperty, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Name of the InternalProperty
        newValue - New value

      • substituteParameter

        public void substituteParameter(java.lang.String paramHash,
                       UIParameter uiParameter)
        Substitute the parameter indexed by paramHash with uiParameter. This is used to resolve collisions between two parameters with same hash: their respective ConfigurablePanel owners then share the same UIParameter.
        Parameters:
        paramHash -
        uiParameter -

      • substituteInternalProperty

        public void substituteInternalProperty(InternalProperty internalProperty)
        Substitutes the InternalProperty with same name and type than internalProperty with it. If no such InternalProperty exists, then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        internalProperty - InternalProperty to substitute with an existing one.

      • getInternalPropertyType

        public InternalProperty.InternalPropertyType getInternalPropertyType(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns the InternalPropertyType of the InternalProperty called propertyName. If there is no such InternalProperty, returns InternalPropertyType.NONE.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Name of the InternalProperty
        Returns:
        The corresponding InternalPropertyType, InternalPropertyType.NONE if there is no such InternalProperty.

      • isComponentTriggeringEnabled

        protected boolean isComponentTriggeringEnabled()
        Checks if the component triggering is enabled. The change in permission is done through turnOffComponentTriggering() and turnOnComponentTriggering(). This is just indicative and only provides a mechanism to avoid triggering the components eventListeners upon calling propertyhasChanged(String, String). For this mechanism to work, setUIPropertyValue(String, String) needs to be called in the eventListeners ONLY if this method returns true. For instance, this can be useful upon loading the UI, as propertyhasChanged(String, String) will be called for each UIProperty, then in turn propertyhasChanged(String, String) will be called and might change the state of a JComponent. Depending on the type of eventListeners, this might trigger setUIPropertyValue(String, String).
        Returns:
        true if the component triggering is on, false if it is off.

      • turnOffComponentTriggering

        protected void turnOffComponentTriggering()
        Turns off component triggering. See isComponentTriggeringEnabled().

      • turnOnComponentTriggering

        protected void turnOnComponentTriggering()
        Turns on component triggering. See isComponentTriggeringEnabled().

      • triggerPropertyHasChanged

        public void triggerPropertyHasChanged(java.lang.String propertyName,
                             java.lang.String newValue)
        Calls propertyhasChanged(String, String) on the EDT. This allows the extension classes of ConfigurablePanel to change the state of a JComponent depending on the value newValue of the UIProperty propertyName (itself linked to a MMProperty). Since a UIProperty does not hold the value of the corresponding MMProperty, it is passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Name of the property
        newValue - New value of the property

      • triggerParameterHasChanged

        public void triggerParameterHasChanged(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Calls parameterhasChanged(String) on the EDT. This allows the subclasses of ConfigurablePanel to adjust its components based on the value of the UIParameter parameterName.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - Name of the parameter

      • initializeProperties

        protected abstract void initializeProperties()
        Method called in the constructor of a ConfigurablePanel. In this method, the subclasses must create their UIproperty and add them to the map of properties using addUIProperty(UIProperty).

      • initializeInternalProperties

        protected abstract void initializeInternalProperties()
        Method called in the constructor of a ConfigurablePanel. In this method, the subclasses must create their InternalProperties and add them to the map of internal properties using addInternalProperty(InternalProperty).

      • initializeParameters

        protected abstract void initializeParameters()
        Method called in the constructor of a ConfigurablePanel. In this method, the subclasses must create their UIparameter and add them to the map of properties using addUIParameter(UIParameter).

      • setupPanel

        protected abstract void setupPanel()
        Method called in the constructor of a ConfigurablePanel after addUIProperty(UIProperty), addUIParameter(UIParameter) and addInternalProperty(InternalProperty). In this method, the subclasses must instantiate their JComponents and build the JPanel (itself) as in any user interface. In particular, the default values of the UIParameters can be used.

      • internalpropertyhasChanged

        public abstract void internalpropertyhasChanged(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Method called when an internal property's value has been changed. This allows the ConfigurablePanel subclasses to react to the change of vale.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Name of the internal property

      • propertyhasChanged

        protected abstract void propertyhasChanged(java.lang.String propertyName,
                      java.lang.String newvalue)
        Notifies the ConfigurablePanel subclass that the MMProperty linked to its UIProperty propertyName has changed in value. This function is called on the EDT and allows the subclass to change the states of its JComponents based on the new value of the UIProperty.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Name of the Property whose value has changed.
        newvalue - New value of the UIProperty

      • parameterhasChanged

        protected abstract void parameterhasChanged(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Notifies the ConfigurablePanel subclass that the UIParameter parameterName value has changed. This method is called upon loading of the UI and whenever the user changes the configuration.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - Name of the UIParameter

      • shutDown

        public abstract void shutDown()
        Allows the ConfigurablePanel subclass to shut down all processes, e.g. SwingWorkers. This method is called when EMU is closing.

      • getDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the description of the ConfigurablePanel.
        Returns:
        Description of the ConfigurablePanel.
